meanings.sent1: The loculate fruit had separate sections for each type of seed.
meanings.sent2: The loculate beehive provided individual spaces for each bee.
meanings.sent3: The loculate jewelry box kept each piece organized and safe.
meanings.sent4: The loculate building resembled a mini city with its separate rooms.
meanings.sent5: The loculate backpack had pockets for every school supply.

meanings.definition: To divide into chambers or compartments.
meanings.sent1: She would loculate the snacks into different containers for the road trip.
meanings.sent2: The architect decided to loculate the office space for better organization.
meanings.sent3: He tried to loculate his thoughts into separate categories, but they kept mixing.
meanings.sent4: The chef would loculate the ingredients before starting the recipe.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to loculate their ideas into different paragraphs.
